metadata.title: Compress PNG to 100KB - Maintain Transparency | Toolaze
metadata.description: Optimize PNGs to 100KB for web performance. Keeps original transparency and format. Process up to 100 images in your browser for free.

intro.title: Professional Web Optimization
intro.content: Heavy PNGs slow down your site. Toolaze optimizes your PNG files locally by re-mapping pixels to hit your 100KB target. We maintain the Alpha channel, ensuring your transparent backgrounds remain perfectly clear for your UI/UX needs.

scenes.title: Lighthouse Optimization
scenes.desc: Help your hero images and icons meet the 100KB performance threshold.

scenes.title: Documentation Assets
scenes.desc: Keep your PDF and Word document sizes low by optimizing embedded PNG screenshots.

scenes.title: Documentation Teams
scenes.desc: Optimize embedded PNG screenshots in PDF and Word documents. Reduce file sizes while maintaining image clarity and transparency.

faq.q: Does it keep the transparency?
faq.a: Yes. Toolaze is specifically designed to preserve the Alpha channel during the compression process.

faq.q: Can I process many files at once?
faq.a: You can batch process up to 100 PNG files in a single session.

faq.q: Will my PNG images look pixelated after compression?
faq.a: No. Toolaze uses intelligent compression algorithms that preserve visual quality while reducing file size. The compression focuses on removing invisible data and optimizing the image structure rather than reducing resolution unnecessarily.

faq.q: Are my design assets uploaded to a server?
faq.a: No! All compression happens locally in your browser using JavaScript and Canvas API. Your PNG images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security for your design work.

faq.q: What's the difference between PNG and JPG compression?
faq.a: PNG compression preserves transparency (Alpha channel) and is lossless, making it ideal for graphics with transparent backgrounds. JPG compression removes transparency and uses lossy compression, which is better for photographs but unsuitable for graphics requiring transparency.

faq.q: Can I use this for icons and logos?
faq.a: Absolutely! PNG compression to 100KB is perfect for icons, logos, and graphics that require transparency. The compression maintains sharp edges and transparent backgrounds, ensuring your branding assets look professional on any background.

metadata.title: USCIS Photo 240KB Compressor - Secure Visa Processing | Toolaze
metadata.description: Meet the DS-160 240KB requirement for US Visa photos. 100% private browser-side processing. No facial alterations, keeping your data real and secure.

intro.title: Secure Document Handling
intro.content: Visa applications require high privacy. Toolaze processes your biometric photos entirely within your browser. By using local math-based compression, we ensure your photo stays under the 240KB official limit without sending your identity to the cloud.

specs.batch: Process up to 100 photos at once

scenes.title: DS-160 Application
scenes.desc: Ensure your photo uploads successfully during the final stage of your visa form.

scenes.title: Green Card Lottery
scenes.desc: Perfect for meeting the digital photo size requirements for the annual DV Lottery.

scenes.title: Family Applications
scenes.desc: Process multiple family member photos simultaneously. Batch compress passport photos for entire family visa applications efficiently.

faq.q: What if it can't reach 240KB?
faq.a: For very high-resolution originals, the tool will scale the dimensions to ensure the 240KB target is reached.

faq.q: Does it edit my face?
faq.a: No. We provide pure technical compression to ensure your facial features remain 100% authentic for immigration standards.

faq.q: Are my biometric photos secure and private?
faq.a: Yes! All compression happens locally in your browser using JavaScript and Canvas API. Your passport photos never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security. No data is ever sent to our servers or stored anywhere.

faq.q: Can I compress multiple family member photos at once?
faq.a: Yes! Toolaze supports batch processing of up to 100 passport photos simultaneously. Perfect for processing photos for entire family visa applications or multiple immigration submissions.

faq.q: Will my compressed photo be accepted by USCIS?
faq.a: Yes. Toolaze maintains the visual quality and authenticity required for immigration purposes while meeting the strict 240KB file size requirement. The compressed photos maintain facial clarity and meet USCIS photo specifications.

faq.q: What photo specifications does USCIS require?
faq.a: USCIS requires passport-style photos that are 2x2 inches, taken within the last 6 months, with a plain white or off-white background, and showing your full face. The file size must be under 240KB for DS-160 applications. Toolaze compresses your photo to meet the file size requirement while maintaining these visual specifications.

hero.desc: 50KB is the most common requirement for online forms. Whether you start with a 5MB or 50MB file, Toolaze helps you reach 50KB in seconds without changing your file format.

intro.title: The Standard for Online Forms
intro.content: From school admissions to resume portals, 50KB is the universal gateway. Toolaze eliminates the guesswork by letting you specify '50KB' as your target. Our browser-side engine handles the heavy lifting, keeping your original format intact for maximum compatibility.

faq.a: We support JPG, JPEG, PNG, WebP, and BMP. Your file will be downloaded in its original format.

faq.q: Is it really free?

faq.a: If your image is already under 50KB, the tool will optimize it further to ensure it meets the exact requirement while preserving quality. The compression algorithm focuses on removing invisible data rather than reducing visual quality.

faq.q: Does it work for passport photos and ID documents?
faq.a: Yes, Toolaze can compress passport photos and ID document scans to 50KB. However, note that some applications may have different size requirements (e.g., USCIS requires 240KB). Always check your specific application requirements before compressing.

content.title: PNG Compression Benefits
content.text: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) is a lossless format that supports transparency, making it ideal for graphics, logos, and images requiring transparent backgrounds. However, PNG files are often significantly larger than JPG filesâ€”typically 2-5 times biggerâ€”which can impact website loading speeds and consume storage space. Compressing PNG images reduces file size by 40-60% while preserving transparency and maintaining visual quality, making them perfect for web use without sacrificing the transparency features that make PNG valuable.
